definition: clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.chinese: 迈克，我真佩服你的勇气。

sentences.english: We all admire his readiness to help others.
sentences.chinese: 我们都佩服他乐于助人的精神。

sentences.english: The other students admired his depth of understanding.
sentences.chinese: 别的学生佩服他的理解力深刻。

sentences.english: She felt the deepest respect for his skill at dissemBling .
sentences.chinese: 她对他的掩饰技巧深感佩服。

sentences.english: Back came a cool letter from the editor that at least elicited Martin's admiration. "We thank you," it ran, "for your excellent contribution.
sentences.chinese: 编辑回了一封冷冰冰的信，可它至少也能令马丁佩服。

sentences.english: But what I admire most about them is their competitive spirit.
sentences.chinese: 不过我最佩服的还是他们的拼搏精神。

sentences.english: He admires the chivalry of knights in Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 佩服中世纪武士的侠义精神。

sentences.english: Mentioned with Mr Chen's serious, we were very pleased with admiration.
sentences.chinese: 说起陈老师的认真，我们都打心眼里佩服。

sentences.english: I truly admired Cai SG , in her determination to conserve and recycle.
sentences.chinese: 我真的佩服蔡师姑对环保的坚持与用心。

sentences.english: I have the highest opinion in the world of Edward's heart.
sentences.chinese: 我对爱德华的那颗心算是佩服到家了。

sentences.english: I admire the Occupiers who are currently doing this. Gets attention.
sentences.chinese: 我很佩服正在做这些的占领者们。

sentences.english: We admire her for her diplomatic tact.
sentences.chinese: 我们佩服她的外交手腕。

sentences.english: Nay, blush not, Cleopatra; I approve Your wisdom in the deed.
sentences.chinese: 不必脸红，克莉奥佩特拉，我佩服你这件事干得聪明。

definition: to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
ashamed of being inferior (idiom)/to feel inferior to others
to consider oneself as being not as good as the others
to have a whole new level of respect for sb or sth/to sit up and take notice (of sb's improved performance etc)
to prostrate oneself in admiration (idiom); to adulate sb
to feel deep veneration for sb (idiom)
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to convince/to subdue/to be convinced/to be bowled over
